question.text: Two balls <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>A</mi></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>B</mi></math> are placed at the top of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>180</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> tall tower. Ball <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>A</mi></math> is released from the top at <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>. Ball <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>B</mi></math> is thrown vertically down with an initial velocity <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>u</mi></math> at <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>. After a certain time, both balls meet <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>100</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> above the ground. Find the value of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>u</mi></math> in <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mo> </mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math>. [use <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>g</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn><msup><mrow><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></math>]

solution.text:
Displacement covered by first ball,180-100=0+12×10×t2   ⇒t=4 s

Now, the second body gets only,  t2=4-2=2 s.

Displacement covered by second will be same,

80=u×2+12×10×22

⇒u=80-202=30 m s-1
